alert.note: Alert for Northern Somerset; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 29 at 9:32PM EST until January 30 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and very cold wind chills. Storm total snowfall of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Northern Somerset and Northwest Aroostook Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 AM EST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 AM EST Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 15 minutes.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frostbite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
